main.name: Patrick Vogel
main.contactmessage: Have a project for me? Think I'd be a good fit for your team? I'd love to hear from you, give me a shout by email or by using the form below if you'd like to get in contact with me.

resume.skillmessage: I'm a tinkerer and am always interested in playing around with new technologies but these are the ones that have really won me over

education.degree: Bachelors in Computer Science, Software Engineering
education.description: My Bachelor Thesis describes the problem of monitoring the performance of Flask-based Python web-services. For the web developer that wants to monitor the performance for their web-services, a solution is presented. The solution consists of an automatic monitoring dashboard, that can be installed in any existing web-service with Python and Flask. After the installation (installation requires 2 lines of code) an automatic monitoring service is ready to use. With several lines of extra configuration, the following features are supported: - Automatic version detection. The monitoring tool detects the active version of this VCS and combines this with the collected data. - Comparison of execution times across different users. Which users perform better or worse on certain versions of the system and how can this be improved? The monitoring dashboard creates graphs automatically, wherein it is easy to spot differences in execution times. - Automatic outlier detection. Whenever the execution time is larger than usual -- an outlier --, the monitoring tool collects extra information about the requested data, such as the stack-trace of active threads, and CPU- and memory usage of the system. In order to reduce the overhead of the dashboard, logging extra information is only done for potential outliers. Moreover, this thesis describes the design of the monitoring tool. After the development of the dashboard, it is deployed for a case study to validate its usefulness. The collected results have been used to analyze and improve the performance of that case study.

education.degree: Masters in Computing Science, specialized in Software Engineering and Distributed Systems
education.description: A key feature of Cloud Computing is to pay proportionally for requested resources. Monitoring is thus essential to finding out the actual resource usage of components. However, existing Cloud Monitoring Solutions are not capable of estimating the operational cost. As such, Cloud Consumers have to rely to the billing provided by the Cloud Provider instead, that is, only deal with cost after the fact. Our research proposes a model which monitors the deployment cost of a containerized Cloud-based Application while it is running, and estimates the waste caused by unused resources provisioned to the application. We introduce an efficient and effective Cloud Monitoring Solution using this model towards allowing for cost optimization on deployment level. We verify this solution by deploying it on an industrial Cloud System.

work.title: Python Backend Software Engineer
work.description: Currently, I'm a Software Engineer at See Tickets Benelux. They are one of the leaders in the global ticketing market, with a strong presence in the United States and Europe. My work consists of maintaining the Python Platform. This platform uses frameworks like Django, Flask and SQLAlchemy. The focus of their platform is code quality, which is supported by exhausting testing implemented by specialized test-frameworks.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: I have used Python for my Bachelors Project and can't do any programming anymore without using Python. It is by far the language I am most familiar with in terms of data-structure and algorithm programming.

skills.name: Flask
skills.description: Flask is an awesome framework that makes writing web applications easy. I started using Flask during my Bachelors Project, and I can't write web applications anymore without the simplicity of Flask.

skills.name: SQLAlchemy
skills.description: SQLAlchemy is the Python SQL toolkit and Object Relational Mapper that gives application developers the full power and flexibility of SQL. Defining schema's using SQLAlchemy makes development easier by providing a higher level of abstraction.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git for all of my projects so far. I have used Git for version control in small teams and have toyed around with contributing to Open Source Projects.

skills.name: Pytest Factory Boy
skills.description: I had the opportunity to learn Pytest Factory Boy via SeeTickets B.V. It is an easy and powerful test framework that makes test driven design easy, as it works fluently with database models.

skills.name: MySQL
skills.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system. I use this database for my daily work, and I am an expert with defining schema's, migrating data, or querying the data using SQL.

skills.name: MongoDB
skills.description: I have used many different database systems and am better educated and experienced with Relational Databases. However, for many applications, the ease of use of MongoDB better suits my needs and it is much more enjoyable to work with.

skills.name: Heroku
skills.description: I use Heroku as my hosting platform for most of my projects because so far they are all unpaid and their free tier is convenient. I also appreciate its integration with Github for such simple deployment.

projects.title: Flask Monitoring Dashboard
projects.category: Automatically monitor the evolving performance of Flask/Python web services.

projects.title: Resume Website

testimonials.text: Rooted on these experiences, my impression of Patrick is of a very capable, highly analytical, strongly motivated and well organized person of acute intelligence. Technically, his background and abilities are of an exceptional level; if not choosing to pursue a PhD he would be easily making a successful career in software development.
testimonials.user: Dr. Vasilios Andrikopolous - Assistant Professor in the Software Engineering and Architecture Group of the University of Groningen
